topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536d946063687221e91e0400#post_536d946063687221e91e0400
History books describe it as a very politically sensitive time. Tons of weird things went on, imaginations flew free, and the world was at its closest to waging an all out nuclear war. If you were suspected of being a Commie, you could be interrogated indefinitely. It was also a time of rise for American living standards, innovations, and wild entrepreneurial-ism.
The Age of Concepts.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
I PM'd a friend of mine on another forum (he collects dinosaur teeth like me). I showed him a link to a _Megalosaurus_ tooth that had been sold on a website (very rare) because I wondered if he was the buyer.

He's kicking himself for not buying it.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536da4f963687219b85c0300#post_536da4f963687219b85c0300
Where do many of these dinosaur fossil get supplied from?
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536da56b6368721a16490300#post_536da56b6368721a16490300
Most dinosaur fossils on the market today are found in Morocco and the US. China and Mongolian fossils are popular but those countries have banned export. Most dealers are in the US with a few in Europe.

"This is the site where the megalosaur tooth was sold.":http://www.indiana9fossils.com/
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097
